A 35-year-old female with a history of rheumatoid arthritis presents with joint pain and swelling. Laboratory investigations reveal elevated levels of anti-citrullinated protein antibodies (ACPA) and rheumatoid factor (RF). Imaging studies show erosions and deformities in the joints. Further investigation reveals activation of caspase-4 and release of IL-1β and IL-18 in the synovial fluid. Which of the following forms of regulated cell death is likely contributing to the joint inflammation and damage in this patient?

A 40-year-old male presents with severe epigastric pain radiating to the back, nausea, and vomiting. Serum amylase and lipase levels are significantly elevated. Abdominal CT scan reveals inflammation of the pancreas. Which of the following types of necrosis is commonly associated with acute pancreatitis?

options.label: A

A 50-year-old female with advanced breast cancer is being treated with chemotherapy. Despite an initial response, the tumor eventually becomes resistant to treatment and starts growing rapidly. Further investigation reveals dysregulation of glutathione peroxidase 4 (GPX4) and increased lipid peroxidation in tumor cells. Which of the following forms of regulated cell death is likely contributing to the resistance to chemotherapy in this patient?

A 45-year-old female with a history of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) presents with palpable purpura and hematuria. Skin biopsy reveals immune complex deposition in the small blood vessels. The renal biopsy shows thickened vessel walls with pink-staining material. Which of the following types of necrosis is typically associated with the histopathologic findings in this patient?

A 50-year-old male with end-stage renal disease presents with joint pain and stiffness. Radiographic examination reveals extensive calcification of the articular cartilage in multiple joints, including the shoulders, hips, and knees. Which of the following types of calcification is most likely responsible for the findings in this patient?

A 55-year-old male presents with progressive weakness and atrophy of his upper and lower limb muscles. Electromyography reveals evidence of denervation, and a muscle biopsy shows the presence of intracellular protein aggregates. Which of the following proteases is primarily involved in the degradation of these protein aggregates?

A 70-year-old male with a history of hypertension and diabetes presents with a non-healing ulcer on his right foot. Physical examination reveals an area of dry, black, and mummified tissue surrounded by healthy skin. Doppler ultrasound shows no blood flow in the affected area. Which of the following types of necrosis is most likely present in the ulcer?

A 40-year-old female presents with recurrent episodes of abdominal pain and bloating, accompanied by diarrhea and constipation. Colonoscopy reveals evidence of inflammatory bowel disease, and a biopsy confirms the diagnosis of Crohn's disease. The genetic analysis revealed single nucleotide polymorphism in ATG16L1 gene. Which of the following cellular processes may play a role in the pathogenesis of this disease?
All of the following are true about metastatic calcification except?

options.label: A
options.text: It is associated with basophilic material deposition on H and E staining in the affected tissue

options.label: B
options.text: It is seen with elevated calcium or elevated phosphate levels

options.label: C
options.text: It is a localised process affecting specific tissues

options.label: D
options.text: It can affect wide range of tissues including lungs and kidneys

questions.correct_answer: C. It is a localised process affecting specific tissues

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about caspases?

options.label: B
options.text: Caspase 1, 4 and 5 are involved with release of interleukin 1

options.text: Caspase 10 is involved in initiation of intrinsic pathway of apoptosis

options.label: D
